label: Folder 06: Whitelaw Memorandum 2
description: Memorandum to Homer M. Pace from Robert N.S. Whitelaw (Dec. 19, 1946) that had enclosed a rough outline of the "Historic Charleston Trust Constitution" that he would be proposing at that day's meeting and suggesting the committee members to proceed with the incorporation.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value: December 19, 1946  Memo to Mr. Homer M. place  Reference to Civic Services Committee meeting at the Gibbes Art Gallery, 5 P. M., December 19, 1946.  Dear Homer:  I am attaching a rough outine of the Historic Charleston  Trust Constitution which I am proposing at a meeting this afternoon. I would ike to suggest that if the plan meets with approva, you appoint the following committee to proceed with the incorporation:  C. BISSE JENKINS  MISS Alice R. HUGER SMITH  Samuel G. STONEY  OUTRE W. BRIGGS  ROBERT N. S. Whitelaw  E. MIBY BURTON  HOMER M. place  MISS Helen G.. MCCORMACK  MISS BEATRICE ST. JUIAN RAVENE  William MASON SMITH  HENRY P. STAATS  CO. ASTON DEAS  EDWARD H. B. PERRY  Sincerely yours,  Robert N. S. Whitelaw  RNSW:ct
